Key Match Events: The Mavericks passed out 33 assists on Wednesday in the 119-99 victory over Chicago at American Airlines Center.
Post-Match Reflections: Dwight Powell provided solid minutes when the Mavericks were pulling away from the Bulls.
O-Max Prosper was solid enough to give Naji Marshall and Klay Thompson some rest periods.
The Mavericks corrected their rebounding issues in the second half, giving the Bulls just five second-chance points compared to 12 for the Mavs in the first half.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mavericks were missing three rotation players but next-man-up worked well.
Naji Marshall had a great game, praised by Coach Jason Kidd.
The Mavericks' three-point barrage helped stop the Lakers and end a losing streak.
Others: Markieff Morris could join the rotation if needed.
The roster depth allowed the team to withstand injuries.
